page.title: 19TRAFFIC SURVEY _S.CROYDON
page.content: We went to count the traffic on the Brighton Road between 8.15. and 9.15.a.m.There were 500 cars bumper to bumper,going either to Purley(south) or Croydon(north) at a slow pace.The people going to Croydon,we thought, were going to offices or shops.Those going south we thought were heading for Coulsdon,Gatwick or possibly Brighton.We expected more cars because of the rain.we were surprised that there were less buses in the morning than in the afternoon.We thought that the trucks were delivering goods. In the afternoon survey we counted 250 cars going in both directions in a steady stream.We thought they had had a lunch break,were part_time workers or mums doing shopping or visiting.
